intro: Coffea bernardiniana, commonly known as the Amazonian coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to the rainforests of South America. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that develop into red, fleshy fruits containing seeds used for coffee. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves and is often found growing in shaded, humid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
